qyllia_recap: ^Let me go over the story one more time, so we're on the same page.

^Once upon a time, there was a village that lived in fear of a great beast. No one would open their doors at night, because the beast walked the streets under moonlight, and anyone who saw it would drop dead.

^A brave knight took her sword and swore to slay the monster, and so when nightfall came she stood in the middle of the town crossroads, and faced the beast. When the sun rose, the beast was nowhere to be found, and she had dropped dead on the spot.

^A cunning thief took his dagger and went to kill the beast in its lair. As the sun lay high in the sky, he went into the deep woods where it lived, to catch it as it slept. He tied a blindfold on his face so the sight of the beast could not sway him, but he never returned from the creature's lair.

^The townspeople began to panic, but a child decided she would set off into the woods to see the beast for herself. "You can't possibly kill the beast," the townsfolk told her. "A brave knight tried, and she dropped dead. A cunning thief tried, and he never returned. You're just a child." But the child filled a knapsack with a stone, a lantern, and three bags of rice, and she left for the deep woods.
